data.title: Good coffee
data.text: This is a nice place for a cup of coffee. Interesting art to view. Enjoyed strolling there from our hotel. Pleasant place to visit.

data.title: Good coffee
data.text: Nice coffee and art shop. Good, friendly service. Some very good coffee.  Got a couple of bags to bring home. Currently drinking the Brazilian Yellow Bourbon. A nice, smooth dark roast. Need to teach their batistas more about the coffee varieties. Could not tell me much about the coffees they were selling.

data.title: Serious coffee
data.text: No wimpy coffee here. Good choice of baked goods, chilled out atmosphere, great for small group conversations, across from a small city park, great wifi and large tables available if you need to spread out, gives a green discount if you bring your own cup for purchases, competent staff, nice changing mix of art on the walls. Nice people work here.

data.title: Art gallery & coffee
data.text:
The decor itself won me over.  There is beautiful art decking each and every wall of this little coffee shop.  It shares a space with Art St. Louis which carries awesome creations from local artist.  

The barista was spunky and super helpful.  I ordered a barrel-aged coffee added a tench of soy milk and was on my way. 

before I hit the door I noticed the delicious quiche, muffins and menu items I'm definitely coming back to try once I'm off my dreadful diet.

data.title: Art and delicious lattes
data.text:
Stumbled on this place when looking for a hot beverage - and was very happy with it. The barista customized a latte for me - a delicious one. The cafe is inside a small art gallery, "Art St Louis", which has small tables and a couch scattered throughout - so you can enjoy your beverage while looking at the displayed artworks. We started wondering through the gallery after placing the order, and the barista was very kind to find us inside and hand us our drinks - we didn't expect that at all! 
Thank you for a lovely experience.

data.title: Kaffee gut, mehr aber nicht
data.text:
Wollte zum Frühstück in die Mississippi Mud Coffee Roasters.
Hab mir einen Dark Roast Kaffee bestellt, der wirklich gut war.
Pastries gab es keine, was mich sehr enttäuscht hat. Das Ambiente, was auf den Fotos gezeigt wird ist auch nicht mehr vorhanden. Schade eigentlich. 
Nur 2 Punkte, wegen dem Kaffee
